Keywords: Cosmic , Kree , Scientist , Soldier
Real Name: Mar-Vell
Special Powers
I CAN'T JUST WATCH THEM DIE...I MUST ACT!: Once per attack, when another friendly character within range and line of fire is targeted with an attack, before the attack is made you may place Captain Mar-Vell in a square adjacent to that character and he becomes the target of the attack instead (even if he would otherwise be an illegal target).
UNI-BEAM BLASTER: Energy Explosion, Penetrating/Psychic Blast. // When Captain Mar-Vell hits with a range attack, give each hit character an action token.
Figure Errata
I CAN'T JUST WATCH THEM DIE...I MUST ACT! was changed
Trade Captain Mar-Vell Want Captain Mar-Vell

hoojeebo
Neither. He becomes the target of the attack, even if it would otherwise be illegal, just like it says.
January 18, 2023
Drisurk
If you place him and he becomes the target even if he would be illegal, like lets say behind a wall or something like that, does you opponent not make an attack since his line of fire will be blocked? Or will he make an attack, but not hit and get an action token?
January 22, 2022
BLsquared
This guy is even more nuts with the prime Alchemical Fire object; want everyone to have -2 attack [I] on top of all the other effects?[/I] I paired him with Infamous Iron Man, Sunspot, and a blue AIM guy and tore apart a Blackheart team. Man.
January 9, 2022
tidge
I agree with other commenters that this figure is WILDLY under-costed. The figure would already has advantages for being adjacent to allies (Leadership, SHIELD TA, PC), but with the trait in play it becomes able to freely place (on an opponent's turn, which can screw with some opponents' teams) such that it can be positioned for a retaliation using multi-target Penetrating/EE/get-a-token. Even without every using the trait, this would be a crazy-good 50-point figure. Captain Mar-Vell may not be the best 50-points-or-under prime for all teams, but it should be a top consideration for ranged-offense teams.
December 30, 2021
Brundun94
Right on, Brainy. I have long berated game inflation. I think power creep has put us dangerously close to critical mass. It feels like a 50 pt piece should be able to do it all anymore. I definitely disliked the period of the game this calculator likely came from, as until about 2016 the game didn't really let you run more than 3 - 4 pieces tops in 300. So the shift to specialist dials was a blast imo. Unfortunately, as usually is the case with wk, they didn't know when to pump the brakes. Specialist dials became generalist dials again, but with the point efficiency of the specialists.
December 30, 2021
fastcat99
Wow....so keep him in the middle of pieces you don't want to lose, like a collossal something, and 'poof' you won't! Oh yeah!
December 26, 2021
brainiacFTW
[QUOTE=Brundun94;12171735]I mean, characters below 80 points rarely got outwit, perplex, or prob when the parameters for that calculator were set. Now, if we get a set that doesn't feature one or more of those powers on at least one common or uncommon for 25 points, we feel cheated.[/QUOTE] I think you've unintentionally laid out the problem rather nicely here (i.e., power creep)
December 16, 2021
Brundun94
I mean, characters below 80 points rarely got outwit, perplex, or prob when the parameters for that calculator were set. Now, if we get a set that doesn't feature one or more of those powers on at least one common or uncommon for 25 points, we feel cheated. This guy is cool and could be potent, if wisely played, but is an outwit and a couple cheap hits from KO in a single turn. Very efficient, but only moderately above average in terms of staying power. If he had SAFEGUARD outwit, then I would say that he could end up being a bit bonkers, but even then, not quite meta viable.
December 13, 2021
Crow
Just for fun I ran him through an old point calculator formula from the early game and he was 155 points without his special text at all. I have no idea how game design justifies this being 50 points.

December 8, 2021
Goop
I really like that you can use Psyblast and EE together now, him having it with triple target makes him especially nasty, AND you token them too. You can also probably do some clever stuff with that defensive trait, pump up his defense with perplex (why is there no perplex in this set?!?!) and have him hop around to everyone protecting them on each attack. He's awesome for his low cost.
